org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.ui.measure

Class MeasureAngle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.ui.measure.Measure
      • org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.ui.measure.MeasureAngle

  • public class MeasureAngle
extends Measure
    The MeasureAngle class is the on-screen measurement class for angular distances. This prompts the user to select points and displays the base angles and angle between them.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.ui.measure.Measure

        COLOR_DA, COLOR_S, COLOR_X, COLOR_Y

      • onDynamicPoint

        public void onDynamicPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D worldPoint)
        Updates the angle measurement state when the mouse moves. The dynamic point is the current mouse point.
        Specified by:
        onDynamicPoint in class Measure
        Parameters:
        worldPoint - The current mouse point in world coordinates.

      • renderInWorld

        public void renderInWorld(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                          float scale)
        Render the measurement in the world. This is the portion of the measurement that displays the picked points and angle lines and arcs.
        Specified by:
        renderInWorld in class Measure
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to render to.
        scale - The scale to render at. This is for line weights, etc.

      • renderInScreen

        public void renderInScreen(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Render the angle measurement to the screen. This is the text portion of the measurement which displays the prompts, base angles, and angle.
        Specified by:
        renderInScreen in class Measure
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics object to render to.
